intro: Sonchus javanicus, commonly known as the Java prickly lettuce, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its hairy, lobed leaves and yellow composite flowers that bloom in the summer. The plant is an annual herb that thrives in disturbed soils and can be found in various habitats such as roadsides and fields. Its leaves are often used in traditional medicine for their purported health benefits. The species is also considered an invasive weed in some regions due to its rapid growth and ability to spread easily.
